title: Compressed Air System Audit and Analysis | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This 5-day course will cover the fundamentals, theories, and concepts involved in compressed air systems.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Compressed Air System Audit and Analysis
Compressed Air System Audit and Analysis
This 5-day course will cover the fundamentals, theories, and concepts involved in compressed air systems.
Power and Clean Energy, Energy Efficiency, Sustainability
In this 5-day course, energy managers, engineers and facility managers will learn about energy-efficient operations and monitoring techniques for compressed air systems.
This course will provide participants with both theoretical knowledge and practical experience on topics relevant to compressed air system audit and analysis.
Energy managers, facility managers, engineers and professionals working in any areas of compressed air system (i.e. design, operation, maintenance, sales of compressed air system)
The fundamentals, theories and concepts involved in the compressed air system
Energy efficient design and operation of compressed air system
Energy efficient assessment and improvement of compressed air system
Case studies and real-world scenarios of energy-efficient operations
Principal Engineer, Energy Systems Management Ltd., and Chair of the Maintenance Engineering Society of New Zealand.
Principal Engineer, Energy Systems Management Ltd., and Chair of the Maintenance Engineering Society of New Zealand.

James has a PhD in Mechanical Engineering from the University of New South Wales and has 26 years’ experience as a professional engineer with expertise in fluid mechanics, thermodynamics, industrial energy efficiency, industrial greenhouse gas emissions reduction, acoustics, and engineering economics in both experimental and numerical modelling applications. He has a wealth of experience in working both in industry and working alongside industrial project partners to deliver successful outcomes that deliver on improved energy efficiency, increased process yields, and enhanced plant and process reliability; with a strong emphasis on realising meaningful gains in Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE). His work has included the establishment and delivery of energy auditor training and accreditation programmes for the New Zealand Industry at a national level for fan, pump, steam, compressed air, and process cooling systems.

After a 16-year stint at the University of Waikato, including the establishment and leadership of the Engineering Energy Research Centre, James is now busy working full-time in the private sector to implement change with a wide range of industry clients and partners. James and his team, work with a strong emphasis on a “total integrated systems engineering approach” to plant and process improvement that incorporates principles of energy efficiency, equipment and process reliability, and process optimisation. James has volunteered extensively both domestically and internationally to better the engineering profession, including over 16 years’ voluntary service on various committees and boards for the Society of Maintenance and Reliability Professionals (SMRP), Vibration Association of New Zealand (VANZ) and the Maintenance Engineering Society of New Zealand (MESNZ). James is the current Chair of the Maintenance Engineering Society of NZ (MESNZ).

Mr. Dennis Tan is a training engineer at SMC Singapore. He is well trained in control technology in the field of Pneumatics and Electro-Pneumatics Systems. His knowledge includes the latest product updates and technology trends, as well as sharing energy-saving techniques in pneumatic equipment. He has experience in conducting customized training, seminars and marketing of SMC products and training systems. He is passionate about learning I4.0 technologies – in specific, carbon emissions reduction in conjunction with machine-to-machine communication for customers.
Types of air compressors, controls and cooling system
Part A - Energy efficiency improving opportunities
Part B – energy efficiency assessment and improvement
Planning EE assessment of compressed air system and methodology
Reporting and documentation of assessment findings
Hands on approach to analyse data from assessment using MS excel reporting and documentation of assessment findings
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course;
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$5,450.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

With the maritime industry turning to lower carbon fuels and energy-efficient technologies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, the Masterclass in Maritime Decarbonisation offered by SIT steers knowledge acquisition in this direction.
Helping SMEs Embed Sustainability in Business

Co-developed with the Association of Small & Medium Enterprises (ASME), the ‘Introduction to Sustainability for Businesses’ course provides companies with the knowledge and frameworks for mapping their sustainability goals.
Engineering Career Success Through Continuous Learning

Professional requirements compelled 36-year-old electrical engineer Loo Yee Chye to upskill. In the process, he discovered how going back to university was a boon to his daily work and long-term aspirations.
Electrical Engineering, Power and Clean Energy
Learning for Life Series - Poh Chye Wei

As an electrical consultant running his own start-up, Poh Chye Wei has to stay at the forefront of the industry’s changing landscape. Inspired by his father, an engineer in the power sector, find out how attending continuing education courses from SITLEARN continues to give Chye Wei a leg up in contributing to his industry.
Electrical Engineering, Power and Clean Energy

Explore elements that contribute to sustainable and resilient data centres, focusing on innovative technologies and strategies that ensure business continuity and minimise downtime during disruptions.
Building Services, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Executive Education
District Cooling Systems: Technologies, Components, and Sustainable Engineering
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering
Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Master sustainable business practices to boost operational performance, focusing on SEA and B Corp certifications for long-term growth and resilience.
Leadership and Communication, Business Management, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency
Motor Driven Systems, Audit and Analysis
This course covers energy conservation opportunities for motor-driven equipment, including MDS design, system evaluation, and energy management programmes.
Design and Performance Assessment of Low Carbon Buildings
Offers a comprehensive overview of low carbon buildings, emphasising engineering aspects of design and operation for sustainable development goals.
Building Services, Energy Efficiency, Sustainability, Executive Education
Pump and Piping Network: Energy Efficient Design, Audit and Analysis
This intensive course is for energy professionals with pre-requisite knowledge and experience, seeking to upskill in pump and piping systems.
Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, Energy Efficiency, Sustainability
